definition: to rob/to plunder/to seize by force/to coerce/calamity/abbr. for kalpa 劫波[jie2 bo1]

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
to kidnap/to hijack/to abduct/to hold under duress
to loot a burning house/to profit from sb's misfortune (idiom)
consigned to eternal damnation/with no hope of reprieve

sentences.english: In immeasurable, inconceivable, innumerable kalpas ago.
sentences.chinese: 过去无量不可思议无央数劫。

sentences.english: Common planning a blade etc FaChang and rescue the knife grain rob dragon.
sentences.chinese: 刀锋等人共同筹划着劫法场，救出刀纹龙。

sentences.english: Shear Biao to then rob the meaning of wealth.
One. That Buddha's lifespan was four hundred billion asamkhyeya kalpas .
sentences.chinese: 彼佛寿命四百千万亿阿僧祇劫。

sentences.english: He was teaching the sutras to the heavenly beings and the earthly beings in the world for forty two kalpas .
sentences.chinese: 在世教授四十二劫，时为诸天及世人民说经讲道。

sentences.english: Thus the telling murals of catastrophe and martial law.
sentences.chinese: 所以，其壁画描写了大灾劫和军事解严。

sentences.english: You're really lucky the mugger just hit you instead of stabbing you.
sentences.chinese: 你很运气，抡劫犯没捅死你，只是打了你一下。

sentences.english: After marriage, Tao Juanping works in a steamboat company.
sentences.chinese: 《桃李劫》是电通公司的第一部作品。

sentences.english: The robber grabbed a car and made his escape.
sentences.chinese: 那强盗劫了一辆轿车逃走了。

sentences.english: We have gone through this samsara (rounds of rebirth) for many aeons, and we have done good things and bad things.
sentences.chinese: 我们在轮回中经历了很多劫，做过善事和恶事。

definition: to levitate heavenwards (a Daoist success)/to take off/to soar (of prices)
to levitate heavenwards (a Daoist success)/to take off/to soar (of prices)
Mahayana, the Great Vehicle/Buddhism based on the Mayahana sutras, as spread to Central Asia, China and beyond/also pr. [Da4 cheng2]
